Sentencas: In this study, Gd and Ca co-doped ceria electrolytes with the compositions of Ce0.8Gd0.2-xCaxO2-d(x = 0 -0.08) were prepared by a novel gel-casting method.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: The effects of the addition of Ca on the phase compositions, sintering behavior, and electrical properties of samples were investigated.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: According to the scanning electron microscope results and relative density measurement results, it is found that the addition of particular quantity of CaO can promote the sintering densification with a uniform grain growth.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: When the sintering temperature is 1400 ?C, the sample with 6 mol% addition of Ca has the highest relative density, which reaches 98.5% of the theoretical density.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: The electrical properties testing results confirm that the electrical conductivity of the samples can be improved significantly by doping appropriate CaO content.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: The maximum conductivity of 0.082 S/cm can be obtained at 800 ?C in the Ce0.8Gd0.12-Ca0.06O1.87 sample.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive

Sentencas: It suggests that CaO can be used as an effective sintering aid and a codopant on the optimization of electrical properties for ceria-based electrolytes.
Titulo: A strategy for improving sinterability and electrical properties of gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte using calcium oxide additive
